abstract_summ: More than two months passed, given that there are still a few new confirmed cases in China every day, and the number of new cases in Italy, Spain, United States of America, Iran (Islamic Republic of) has increased rapidly in recently, the complete control of the outbreak on a global scale remains a difficult process.Since the first case of novel coronavirus pneumonia was diagnosed in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, the disease has broken out all over the world, and the number of worldwide confirmed cases has exceeded 640000 up to March 30, 2020.In December 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus pneumonia (NCP, officially named Coronavirus Disease 2019(COVID-19) by the World Health Organization) broke out in Wuhan, Hubei, and it quickly spread to the whole country and abroad.In the largest number of cases described to date of hospitalized patients with SARS-CoV-2 disease (2019-nCoViD), 26% required care in an intensive care unit (ICU).Abstract On 31 December 2019, the Health Commission of Hubei Province of China first unveiled a group of unexplained cases of pneumonia, which WHO subsequently defined as the new coronavirus of 2019 (SARS-CoV-2).
title_summ: [Management and clinical thinking of Coronavirus Disease 2019].[Clinical consideration and management of coronavirus disease 2019].Intensive care during the 2019-coronavirus epidemic2019 novel Coronavirus outbreak: a quiz or final exam?Emergency measures for acute oral mucosa diseases during the outbreak of COVID‐19How Should the Rehabilitation Community Prepare for 2019-nCoV?
title_abstract_phrases: Emergency measures for acute oral mucosa diseases during the outbreak of COVID‐19Since the first case of novel coronavirus pneumonia was diagnosed in Wuhan, China, in December 2019, the disease has broken out all over the world, and the number of worldwide confirmed cases has exceeded 640000 up to March 30, 2020.This narrative literature review aims to gather the main contributions in the area of intensive care to date in relation to the epidemiology, clinic, diagnosis and management of 2019-nCoViD.2019 novel Coronavirus outbreak: a quiz or final exam?The 2019 novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV) is an emerging pathogen and is threatening the global health.More than two months passed, given that there are still a few new confirmed cases in China every day, and the number of new cases in Italy, Spain, United States of America, Iran (Islamic Republic of) has increased rapidly in recently, the complete control of the outbreak on a global scale remains a difficult process.In response to the above questions, we put forward corresponding suggestions and reflections from the perspective of the infectious clinician.[Clinical consideration and management of coronavirus disease 2019].Coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) outbreak in Wuhan city, Hubei province in December 2019 and the epidemic so rapidly happened within the whole country and abroad, raising serious problems and urgent concerns, such as: how to control most effectively human-to-human transmission?[Management and clinical thinking of Coronavirus Disease 2019].In December 2019, the 2019 novel coronavirus pneumonia (NCP, officially named Coronavirus Disease 2019(COVID-19) by the World Health Organization) broke out in Wuhan, Hubei, and it quickly spread to the whole country and abroad.
